org.jcvi.jillion.experimental.align

Class AlnFileWriter<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.experimental.align.AlnFileWriter<R,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - the type of Residue to be written.
    S - type of Sequence to be written.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, AlnWriter<R,S>

    public abstract class AlnFileWriter<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
extends Object
implements AlnWriter<R,S>
    AlnFileWriter can write aln encoded alignment files like those produced by Clustal.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Detail

      • createNucleotideWriterBuilder

        public static AlnFileWriter.AlnFileWriterBuilder<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence> createNucleotideWriterBuilder(File outputFile)
        Create a new AlnFileWriter.AlnFileWriterBuilder that will build a AlnFileWriter to write out NucleotideSequence alignments in aln format to the given output file.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - the output file to write to; can not be null. If this file already exists, then the writer will overwrite the old data. If this file does not exist, then it will be created.
        Returns:
        a new AlnFileWriter.AlnFileWriterBuilder instance; will never be null.

      • createAminoAcidWriterBuilder

        public static AlnFileWriter.AlnFileWriterBuilder<AminoAcid,ProteinSequence> createAminoAcidWriterBuilder(File outputFile)
        Create a new AlnFileWriter.AlnFileWriterBuilder that will build a AlnFileWriter to write out ProteinSequence alignments in aln format to the given output file.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - the output file to write to; can not be null. If this file already exists, then the writer will overwrite the old data. If this file does not exist, then it will be created.
        Returns:
        a new AlnFileWriter.AlnFileWriterBuilder instance; will never be null.

      • write

        public void write(String id,
                  S sequence)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: AlnWriter
        Write the given (full length) sequence in aln format. The AlnWriter will handle breaking the sequence up into groups and computing conservation etc.
        Specified by:
        write in interface AlnWriter<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the sequence; can not be null, must be unique from all the other sequences being written to the aln.
        sequence - the sequence to write. If this sequence is empty, then it is ignored. Any non-empty sequences written all must have the same (gapped) length.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing the sequence.
